content: The "Zero Gravity, Zero Tax Act of 2005" is introduced, which excludes space-related income from gross income according to a new section 139B in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Zero Gravity, Zero Tax Act of 2005" introduces a new section 139B in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, stating that gross income shall not include space-related income. Space-related income includes income from products or services produced in outer space, services performed in outer space, and certain interest, rent, or royalty amounts related to space activities. The "Zero Gravity, Zero Tax Act of 2005" introduces exceptions for telecommunications services, weather or earth observation satellite services, and transportation services to or from outer space. It also excludes wages received by employees and outlines proportional allocation of income between space-based and earth-based activities. The "Zero Gravity, Zero Tax Act of 2005" exempts products manufactured in outer space from federal taxes if launched from or manufactured at a facility owned by US persons. The amount excluded from taxes will be gradually reduced after 2014. The "Zero Gravity, Zero Tax Act of 2005" exempts products made in outer space from federal taxes based on the number of years after January 1, 2015. Amendments are made to the general business credit and conforming amendments are made to section 196 of the tax code. The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the tax code is amended to include a new item under section 45I(a). The amendments made by this section apply to costs incurred after December 31, 2005. A new section is added for the exclusion of gains from the sale of stock of qualified space corporations. The text discusses the exclusion of gain on the sale of stock of qualified space corporations, defining such corporations as those organized for providing products or services in outer space with certain expense requirements. Exclusion for gains from sale or exchange of stock of qualified space corporations. Effective Date: Amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2005.
